item.title: How to load data from SQL Server to Pandas Dataframe in Python
item.description: Here is the way of building connections between SQL Server and Python. Then import data from SQL Server to Pandas Dataframe. import pyodbc import pandas as pd conn = pyodbc.connect('Driver={SQL Server};' 'Server=localhost;' 'Database=DataBase;' 'Trusted_Connection=yes;') query = "select * from DataBase.dbo.annual_demand" df = pd.read_sql(query, conn) conn.close()
